pullRequest.body:
If `M` is an intermediate field between field extension `L/K`, then `M` acts continuously on `L` and bot act continuously on `M`. The `M` acts continuously on `L` part is proved in a more general setup.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #18141

nodes.body:
### PR summary [94e311a811](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18142/commits/94e311a8110ce2753c61aaecaec955b000b179fa)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.IntermediateField`|1405|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IntermediateField.botContinuousSMul`
`+ IntermediateField.continuousSMul`
`+ Subalgebra.continuousSMul`
`+ Subfield.continuousSMul`
`+ Subring.continuousSMul`
`+ continuousSMul`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

The large import change is caused by the bot element of `IntermediateField` being defined unexpectedly late. It could be defined as early as in the file containing `IntermediateField`'s definition. However, it is not defined until the file `Mathlib.FieldTheory.Adjoin`.

In order to solve this, I created a new file specialized for the `ContinuousSMul` instances for intermediate fields.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/95dfba1e-4afc-46ff-81e1-93a283c0c141) for commit 774ee5eae00fee270713868516ea3cde893810d8.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/7d48438f-f95a-4225-8afd-e07607fcf49f) for commit b0efef16ad852808df95f31932922cf62db3da3d.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/df612837-43ed-4230-9f34-fcb074234f69/to/7d48438f-f95a-4225-8afd-e07607fcf49f) against commit e98856ac3d770804555e9e8c5e96a7512429f10f:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.Galois.Profinite              instructions    30.9%
+ ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.IntermediateField.Algebraic   instructions   -22.7%
- ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.IntermediateField.Basic       instructions     8.8%
+ ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.Discriminant     instructions    -7.9%
```

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|-560.257‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.42%)|
|`lint`|-103.439‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+1.57%)|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.Galois.Profinite`|+14.239‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+30.85%)|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.IntermediateField.Basic`|+10.692‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+8.80%)|
<details><summary>2 files, Instructions +4.0‚¨ù10‚Åπ</summary>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.Algebra.Field.Subfield`|+4.200‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+7.24%)|
|`Mathlib.RepresentationTheory.GroupCohomology.Resolution`|+4.103‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+2.81%)|
</details>

<details><summary>4 files, Instructions +1.0‚¨ù10‚Åπ</summary>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.SeparableDegree`|+1.914‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+1.20%)|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.Fixed`|+1.441‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+1.48%)|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.PrimitiveElement`|+1.301‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+2.29%)|
|`Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Ring.Basic`|+1.24‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+7.74%)|
</details>

<details><summary>2 files, Instructions -2.0‚¨ù10‚Åπ</summary>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.PurelyInseparable`|-1.24‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.50%)|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.PolynomialGaloisGroup`|-1.646‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+3.77%)|
</details>

<details><summary>2 files, Instructions -4.0‚¨ù10‚Åπ</summary>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.Trace.Basic`|-3.153‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+3.73%)|
|`Mathlib.NumberTheory.Cyclotomic.PrimitiveRoots`|-3.974‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+5.52%)|
</details>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.Norm.Basic`|-4.456‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+7.56%)|
<details><summary>2 files, Instructions -6.0‚¨ù10‚Åπ</summary>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.SeparableClosure`|-5.254‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+8.8%)|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.Galois.Basic`|-5.917‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+6.95%)|
</details>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.Adjoin`|-6.71‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+2.20%)|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.IntermediateField.Algebraic`|-11.941‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+22.68%)|
|`Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.Discriminant`|-17.290‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+7.94%)|

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18141~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!

@jjdishere any idea why `Mathlib.FieldTheory.Galois.Profinite` has such a significant slowdown?

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/Algebra/Field): `ContinuousSMul` for intermediate fields
